revised_title: Isotope Effects in Hydrogen Bonds: Further Examples and Observations
tldr: The author investigates the isotope effects in hydrogen bonds within various crystals, confirming previous conclusions about the behavior of hydrogen bonds and discovering new facts about their properties. The study uses X-ray diffraction to compare lattice spacings in hydrogen and deuterium compounds, providing insights into the role of resonance effects and the influence of different bond lengths and types.
